utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.utterance: Hi, I'm Bret Baier, with Dr. Nicole Saphier, Juan Williams, Jesse Watters, and she plays hot scotch in a desk calendar, Dana Perino, THE FIVE. Citing security concerns during a shutdown, Nancy Pelosi has asked Donald Trump to give his State of the Union in writing. Trump's response, canceling her trip to Brussels right before takeoff. It's hilarious. In the letter, he said he was sorry to inform her that he's canceling the trip. No, no. He wasn't sorry, not at all. He basically stole her lunch money and then he ate her lunch. Still, Trump should accept her offer and send the address in writing, a sheet with just two words, bye-bye, then hold a giant event in the middle of America. After all, the people elected Trump, not Washington, D.C. Nancy and the Dems can take shelter under their desks and watch it on all on iPads. And Trump can cite his achievements, tell some jokes, just so the press has a reason to burn their hair. Broadcast it on YouTube. The media will cover it and highly flammable fact checks. It will be the first people's State of the Union. If the media doesn't show it, then we know it's personal and political. For this is historical and hysterical because what do the Dems do then? Do they not respond when he does it anyway at a better place with better looking people with music, prizes, farm animals and face painting? And almost no carbon footprint, think about that. Do they hold a response with the same cardboard cutouts from before? Now, Nancy just offered Trump an amazing opportunity. It gets him out of a really dull speech and it gets "The Five" out of going to D.C., a place with overpriced booze, incompetent politicians, and substandard food, which really is the whole point of this monologue. All right, originally, we're going to talk about the State of the Union, but we've got to talk about this letter, which is fantastic. Dear Madam Speaker, due to the shutdown, I'm sorry to inform you -- I'm sorry to inform you that your trip to Brussels, Egypt, and Afghanistan has been postponed. We will reschedule the seven-day excursion when the shutdown is over. Oh gees. This -- obviously, if you'd like to make your journey by flying commercial, that would certainly be your prerogative. Dana, OK, some might say this is childish or -- I think Juan thinks this is childish. I think it's childishly awesome.

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, HOST
utterances.utterance: You've just stole my notes. You stole my notes.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, HOST
utterances.utterance: He can read your mind. He can read your mind. So this story broke during the 2 o'clock hour and I had John Roberts on, Peter Doocy, and we find out that not only is he canceling the trip --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- but the trip is supposed to leave in 30 minutes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So they're on the bus on Air Force bus with the Capitol Police ready to go.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She already took her Ambien.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They never do that. Never take Ambien until you're on the runway about to takeoff.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You fall asleep and it gets delayed.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right. And then you could get in trouble and all the things. So, I knew something was going to happen today --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- because it was like just the timing. I also feel like because the president was silent yesterday in response to her suggestion that he reschedule the State of the Union because of security, but now it's actually just because of the shutdown and her leverage, that they waited until that 30 minutes before that bus was supposed to leave in order to do it. And it is kind of like a reality TV show. So, I think, oh, tit for tat. There, I understand the thing about their security concerns, who's going to Afghanistan. But here's the thing, what congressional delegation think it's a good idea to leave town when the shutdown is entering its fifth week?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think he actually just saved them some major embarrassment.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think they're both doing each other a favor. But, Juan, I want to get to you because I know that you thought it was idiotic or childish. But, see, what makes us laugh should also bring you pleasure.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's not funny?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You should be happy that I'm happy.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Look, I'm entertained. I love this show. I think it's great. I -- you know, let's make fun of everybody. But at some point, you've got to say, you know, was it Gary Cohn, economic advisor to Trump said today he doesn't understand where this is going. It's bad for the economy. We see the economy --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- being damage. There's real consequence. So, yeah, I love a laugh, too. I've got no problems. But I will say this, to Dana's point, I think it was President Trump who actually went overseas to a war zone during the shutdown.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah. That was a talking point.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.utterance: That's when Pelosi was in Hawaii.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No. In other words, Trump is being totally hypocritical and delighting in it by saying, oh, I'd like you to be here so you can negotiate. Well, wait a second. Didn't he leave town?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Pelosi wasn't in town, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Doesn't matter because he was gone -- he was gone, Jesse. He was gone. So, I mean, to me, what you see today is, oh, Trump is now saying let's bring back some diplomats. Oh, OK. Yesterday, it was let's bring back some IRS agents. He is so on the defensive, so losing this fight right now that he is trying to lessen the impact of the shutdown on the American people, but he delights in boorish behavior, skewering Nancy Pelosi, making himself look, in Greg's words, childish.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Jesse, I want to shift a little bit to the offer that Pelosi is giving because I believe he should accept the offer, do it in writing and hold this rally, but you disagree with me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, I'm pro-State of the Union. I want to see the president blast the Democrats and have Nancy sit next to Pence and squirm without being able to respond. And then maybe if she wants to, she can respond with Crying Chuck at one podium afterwards and get hammered because I like the pageantry of it, and usually, the president gets a little bit blast (ph).

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You want to go to D.C. Just admit it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think the food is delicious in D.C. and --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You want to stay at the Trump Hotel.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I would never stay there, right. The company is paying for it. It would be a conflict of interest. And you know I'm always on the up and up with these things. Also, remember the last time the Democrats just sat on their hands --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- and then they said the African-American, Hispanic-American unemployment was at record -- unemployment at record lows. So, there are political winds to be had for the president at the State of the Union, and she just doesn't want the president to have the opportunity to go make the case for the American people. But what he did today was pure savage. Nancy Pelosi is petty, but no one is more petty than Donald Trump. She went low and he went lower.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And my favorite line is you can fly commercial like JetBlue flies to Afghanistan? Please. I mean, she'd been in Hawaii, Juan. Her crew was in Puerto Rico. She hadn't been at the White House for a week and then she's going to Brussels and Afghanistan for another week. She doesn't want to end the shutdown. She likes it. She thinks she's scoring points.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Let me ask you something, I know you like Trump, but was that an endorsement of Trump to say he's going lower than -- lower than low?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's gamesmanship. And Juan, you can't say that what Pelosi did the other day with the State of the Union was a great power play and this is childish? Everybody on the left --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think it was a great power play. I said -- here's what I've said. You know what, the government is broken, the government is not functioning, and to stand up there pretend like everything is normal is madness.

utterances.speaker: NICOLE SAPHIER, HOST
utterances.utterance: It reconfirms exactly what Jesse is saying. Trump and Pelosi are made for each other, right? So, one goes one way, one goes the other way, whatever. The bottom line is, as a parent, it reminds me a lot of the Saphier (ph) household or just a bad telenovela the way this is playing out. And unfortunately, we can laugh at it. It's funny. But it's not funny because these are actually supposed to be the adults of our country.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, it's funny.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: And so, whether he goes to the State of the Union, it's going to be the same thing. It's a political episode. We're going to see the Democrats maybe squirm a little bit. It's going to be a Democrat bashing session. Nothing is actually going to come out of it. And, you know, Nancy Pelosi's spokesperson, her -- she -- they came out and said that the purpose of her trip was to express appreciation, thanks to our men and women of service. You know how she can do that? By staying here and getting the government back and start paying the Coast Guard because they're not getting paid. They're also men and women in uniform that she's supposed to --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I do wonder a little bit about this because, you know, when I was at the White House, I would do this thing called a sister test. So, I would call my sister and say like what do you think about this? And if she said, never heard of it. I'm like, oh, thank God, we're all right. But today, she said something to me -- she sent me a text and she's like, both of them, could they just get it together?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Something like that. And I wonder if that's more -- of course, we can laugh for a moment, it is rightfully funny, but there are consequences for people there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Rand Paul made a suggestion. Do you want to play that tape? Do we have time or should I just summarize it? Nobody's talking to me. Well, go ahead.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Is that (ph) the Shutdown Prevention Act?

utterances.speaker: SEN. RAND PAUL, R-KY.
utterances.utterance: Yeah. I think that's a real affront to the American people. And what I would suggest is that Senator McConnell in charge of the Senate. Let's host it in the Senate. This is the first time in history that the House would deny a president a forum of speaking. If she's going to do that, let's hold it in the Senate.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I do not like this idea. This is boring.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's even more boring.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's even more boring. Don't host it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You want to see a rally like Billings, Montana.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No. Mar-a-Lago. I want to get a few days in the sun.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What about going to El Paso?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He had a speech already, you know. He had a speech already in the Oval Office. Did it move anything? Did it change anything?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This is the State of the Union address. It is a unifying thing for the country. There's very few traditions left --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Do you think it would be unifying? I think he's staying up just telling more distortions and lies and misrepresentations.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: Government shutdown is not unifying right now.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But I'm also OK with it going back to a written thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Me, too.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That was the original intent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But the way -- they're having a Super Bowl. You need a lot of security for that too, OK? We'll have more on the president canceling Pelosi's overseas trip later. But first, a new debate about what to do with Syria after the latest ISIS terror attack.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: President Trump reacting to the terror attack in Syria yesterday that killed four Americans. ISIS is now claiming responsibility for that suicide blast. Here's the president at the Pentagon earlier.

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Before presenting the results of our missile defense review, I want to take a moment to express my deepest condolences to the families of the brave American heroes who lay down their lives yesterday in selfless service to our nation. These are great people, great, great people. We will never forget their noble and immortal sacrifice.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The attack reigniting the debate over whether the president should withdraw troops from Syria. Jesse, I'm noting that so many Republicans, prominent Republicans say, you know, the president makes this announcement and suddenly we have an attack, and could it be that, in fact, the idea that he announced his plans led ISIS to take this action.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There's a school of thought when you announce you're pulling out that it would encourage attacks because then it looks, from a propaganda perspective, that you're running with your tail between your legs and you can't win the fight there. But that's just propaganda. I think Trump has a very black-and-white view of the Middle East. He believes we're there for oil and to stop the Iranians from gaining more power. And that's it. And he very much dislikes the fact that these rich nations were protecting and they're not paying us a security retainer. He very much dislikes that. And he heard all these generals for many, many years say that, you know, this is going to be generational fight with ISIS. And what happens? He came in in two years and destroyed about 90 percent of the caliphate. I do understand the need to keep troops there for intelligence gathering purposes and to go after high-value targets, and that's an argument that needs to be had, but this is previewing his Afghanistan pullout. I think you're going to see that soon. What's very interesting, Juan, is the Democrats had totally flip-flopped on Syria. When Obama was going in there with troops, the Democrats were saying no, no, don't go in. And now Trump wants to pull out and they're saying no, no, stay. It's just amazing. It's Trump derangement syndrome.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Nicole, I was struck that several people said to me -- do you remember when the president said that President Obama was wrong to announce his plans because once you do that the enemy knows what you're up to.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: Absolutely. And unfortunately, I'm actually am OK with it. I don't necessarily need to know the ins and outs of what's going on at the White House day to day. People are very upset saying this is a rush decision being made. All of a sudden the president announced that he was pulling out troops. We don't actually know the conversations that have been had. All I know is that he campaigned on the fact to take troops out. He wasn't there to end the civil war, this big power play that's going on there. In his eyes, he has done what he said he -- to do, defeated ISIS. And now, he's trying to uphold his campaign promise by bringing the troops out. So, he's doing what the American people elected him to do. I'm not a national security or an international policy person at all, but all I know is that he keeps saying he's going on what he was elected to do. And I can't fault him for that. I do hope that he is listening to people around him because there could be some major consequences by pulling these out. I don't necessarily think that just because there was an attack today that there needs to be a halt on his plans.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, Dana, you know, Nicole was saying she hopes he's listening to people around him, but we know Jim Mattis is gone, Brett McGurk, who was the envoy to deal with ISIS, is gone, both protested the withdrawal. How do you see it?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think you have to look at John Bolton and Mike Pompeo. They're the president's advisors. They were just over in the region. The president said, OK, if we hit these benchmarks, that's when we start drawing down. General Jack Keane today on The Daily Briefing said we have a very light footprint there in Syria. We don't have actually people on the ground fighting. We have advisors there. What we know is that -- what Jesse said is like, yes, of course, they'll come after you. I wouldn't disagree that the generational war is not against ISIS. The generational war is against radical Islamic extremism. So, we lost four soldiers yesterday. We also lost an American on Monday in Nigeria because of al-Shabaab, which is an al Qaeda offshoot. They come from Somalia into Kenya. And so, this is a generational war. And I looked at people like Dan Crenshaw, Michael Waltz, Adam Kinzinger, all of them who had served and now are serving in congress who had said on air, in the last 48 hours, we were willing to go back over and over again. We believe that fighting them there is better than fighting them here. And every day that we prevent a 9/11 is a good day, but we have to keep our foot, our boot on the throat, right? Is that what they say, on the neck?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Jennifer Griffin, our Pentagon correspondent, Greg, said -- she quotes a foreign diplomat as saying these troops have a bull's eye on them when the president telegraphs that he is ordering a pullout. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, I don't get -- I don't understand how the -- how that announcement would incite ISIS to do this because it would just make us want to go back in. So I'm not sure. I don't necessarily agree whether that's related. But I do believe you can hold two thoughts in your head at the same time, meaning you can believe that you are crushing ISIS but you will continue to crush them. That's how we treat cockroaches. Terrorism is one big cockroach mitigation system. The earth is the house. Terrorists are the roaches. Unfortunately, a lot of the tenants hate it when you spray for them. But that's their problem. The thing that really bothers me is that the media narrative, it could be expressing horror over this vile attack and stressing vigilance against an existential terror, radical Islam, and how it feels terror. That's how the media narrative could be. Instead, it's steepened in this smug mantra. Oh, but I thought ISIS was defeated. It was like they were -- there're people in the media taking pleasure out of this to say ho, ho, ho, ho, ho. I thought it was over. Pence said it was over. It was disgusting how pleased they were over this.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wait a second. I think there're people here who said that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What? Said what?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: ISIS is a -- it's a point of credit to President Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wait, you missed my point. What I'm saying is -- what I'm saying is people saw this and used it as a point to smugly refer to that rather than understanding that you can destroy 90 percent of -- but it still exists. This idea will exist forever. That's what I'm saying. You could have two thoughts in your head. You can say you're crushing ISIS but it's never going to end because it's an idea. Ideas are basically immortal, right?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think that's right. But I must say also, and I think Dan Crenshaw might have picked up on this, that there's a power vacuum. And so you have Russia, you have Iran, you have, of course, Turkey sitting there going after American allies who fought with us. That's a danger too. So I think ISIS till exists, but I also think the president has not thought out all the consequences of this action. Brand-new reaction to President Trump canceling Speaker Pelosi's overseas trip, we're going to have that for you coming up. But first, Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez tries to confront Senator Mitch McConnell over the shutdown. We're going to show you this. You're going to want to see it. That's next here on The Five.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right, a group of freshmen has Democrats running around Capitol Hill yesterday looking for Mitch McConnell. The group is trying to deliver a letter to the Senate majority leader demanding that he reopen the government, but they had a little trouble tracking him down.

utterances.speaker: REP. ALEXANDRIA OCASIO-CORTEZ, D-N.Y.
utterances.utterance: We're marching over to Mitch McConnell's office and show him what's up, isn't that right?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: OCASIO-CORTEZ
utterances.utterance: Hashtag where's Mitch? You can run but you can't hide. We went to his office at the Capitol. We went to his office here at the Russel Building. We went to the floor. He's not -- we went to the cloakroom. He's not in the cloakroom. He's not in the Capital. He's not in the Russell Building. He's not on the floor of the Senate. And 800,000 people don't have their paychecks. So where's Mitch?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I wonder -- you know, Jesse, I sort of felt like she should be asking where's Chuck because Chuck is the one who's going to cut the deal with the White House.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: True.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I also found out that when they got over there and they found out McConnell wasn't there, the staff offered water and chocolates, a cup of coffee. And also, they had not made a copy of the letter that they wanted to give to him so they offered to make -- they made a copy for them and sent them on their way.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, it's gonzo journalism tactics. And I have some familiarity with that because when I used to run around the streets for O'Reilly, I used to insert myself into the story, make a spectacle, and make everything about me. And she's creating the news about herself and that's her role. And she's - - has a very talent to focus attention on an issue and go viral, but not a lot of other Democrats had. But is Cocaine Mitch going to fall for this tactics? No. He sits around, he confirms, judges, he adds Senate seats, and he cuts taxes. This guy has been around a long time.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know, I'm not -- I have -- Mitch McConnell and I always have -- but why do you call him that? It's kind of offensive.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I say it with love. And I think that was a nickname that was given to him by one of his primary opponents. I don't know if he's ever done --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I know it was the West Virginia primary opponent that was then summarily handled by Mitch McConnell.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's totally wrong to just perpetuate such a nasty name.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But, Juan, you know what --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Cocaine Mitch --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Cocaine Mitch is one of the great nicknames ever. I wish my nickname was Cocaine Greg.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That could be arranged.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yours is night fool (ph) Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Sequel.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Sequel.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What do you think about the Democrats turning to Mitch McConnell as their savior --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Is that what she meant by running train?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't know what she meant by running train?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't think she knew what that meant. Anyway, you know what the thing is? AOC is vying to be the Democratic parties Trump. I said this months ago here on The Five. And we help her because we can't help ourselves, but it's not our fault. She just feeds us so much delicious -- so many delicious segments that we can't help ourselves. Rasmussen had a poll that she's like a hypothetical poll she's neck and neck with Trump. It's because politicians are just so boring and crusty that any deviation is delicious, right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Wait, Rasmussen, you're saying?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Rasmussen, yes, yes. She's the Trump of the left right now. She's kind of entertaining to watch. But I hope that people do focus on her ideas because they're old and dead.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know why Jesse said, oh, that that poll may have been --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That poll has got to be --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's a rigged poll.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I will say this to you. You know what strikes me is she is the queen of social media, right? So that's what she's doing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And Trump's the king.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, Trump has been the king, but she's coming strong.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, I agree.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And I find it interesting because as my point is she has no real power. I think that the right is more fascinated with her than the left, but --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, I think the left --

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: I don't actually -- no, no, no.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Go ahead. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: You know, I think that there are a lot -- there's a lot of contention going-on on the left right now. And I think that she is ruffling feathers and maybe it's for the good of the party, maybe not. The thing that bothers me is they look like a bunch of college students running around doing some sort of like sorority hunt or something, some fun and games when it's not fun and games what we're talking about. They said that the only thing left for them to do is to create noise. Well, actually, you know what they can do? They can start working on uniting their party. You have House Majority Leader Hoyer saying that the -- building a wall is actually not immoral and it does work, but he just questions the effectiveness of it. But then you have Congressman Omar who says that it's -- calls it the racist big wall. That's the problem. They have a massive divide. Come together. If they really feel --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Let me just tell you, doc. If they had a massive divide, they wouldn't be standing unified against Trump who's even trying to split Democrats off and can't do it.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: No. They're just unified against Trump. We're trying to talk about immigration reform and that's why the government is shutdown --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: -- because they're not giving it. They're OK with some areas of the fence.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We're not talking about immigration reform. Democrats will be glad to talk about immigration reform. All Trump wants to talk about is his political symbol, a wall, that's inefficient --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That works.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- and ineffective.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: That is not ineffective. And, actually, you have Democrats saying that that is actually effective --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: -- in the parts that it's there. Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The parts that are there.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: I'm from Arizona. I know what happens in Yuma. You put up fences there, and all of a sudden, Yuma is doing amazing instead of not -- of having less and less illegal immigrants and a lot of the drugs that came across there.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Even the people --

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: The fences were -- is it going to stop it? No, it's a barrier. I have small children. They will get over --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, thank you. OK.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: -- those little fences you put up everywhere.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, that's the point, isn't it?

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: But it's a barrier, and it's a deterrent. And it's going to lessen this.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: There are better -- in other words, there are more effective ways to talk about doing border security, rather than -- and I must say, this is why Republicans --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Like what, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- who are in power for those years didn't bring it up --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan -- Juan, what's more effective?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- and didn't --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Human chains.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: A drone.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: A drone. What does a drone do, Juan? A drone watches the illegal crossing?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Exactly. It doesn't watch; it prevents.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: How does that stop?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So you have electronic sensors.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, you can do drones and the wall. How about that? Do we have a deal?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Do we have a deal?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Do we have a deal? Drone and the wall.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Waste of --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's not a waste of money to protect the country.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, I see.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We've got to run.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Hey, you know what I noticed, though? That I like the fact that Nancy Pelosi is worried about the security at the State of the Union, not at the border.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's not true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Got o protect her members, not the country.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Great line, Greg. All right. President Trump grounds Nancy Pelosi's overseas trip in the latest government shutdown skirmish. New reaction, ahead.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: All right. Well, new drama in the government shutdown back and forth. President Trump pulling the plug on Nancy Pelosi's overseas trip just an hour before she was set to take off. This comes after the speaker urged Trump to move his State of the Union address. Lawmakers reacting on both sides to the president's move. I mean, guys --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: It's petty. It's small. It's ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I'm just shocked that she would ever think that she would leave the country. Why would you leave the country with the government shut down and you're speaker of the House?

utterances.speaker: REP. ADAM SCHIFF, D-CALIF.
utterances.utterance: Too often in the last two years, the president has acted like he's in the fifth grade. And to have someone who has that kind of character running the country is an enormous problem at every level.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: I mean, OK, so they're upset that it sounds like someone in the fifth grade is running the country right now. But what is Pelosi doing on the other side? I mean, it's going back and forth. In all frankness, they're just posturing with American policy at this point. And you know, Dana, my question to you is, this is our headline for today. But in all seriousness, what are you going to see tomorrow? Something more dramatic?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, there will be -- right, because it's the show. Right? There has to be something that will be back-and-forth. And in the meantime, I think that the pressure will ratchet up, because as it was reported today, even the White House is saying that the shutdown is having an effect on GDP, cutting it by about .1 percent every week that this goes on. That could start to add up. You see stories about government workers having to figure out food banks. Right? So that they can do that. Yesterday, as Tyrus said, he talked to his friends in the Coast Guard who said they can't actually complete some of their work that they need to do to protect the Eastern Seaboard. So, you know, there's also problems that come that way. And also 70 percent of workers all across America, 78 percent of Americans that work full-time, live paycheck to paycheck. So this is -- this is very real for a lot of people, and I understand why -- of course, I get it. We've laughed about it. I laughed about it at 2 p.m. when he stopped her trip. And it's not just him punching her. Right? Remember, this is in response to her saying that "You shouldn't come and do the State of the Union during the shutdown." So when they're talking about the president being petty, you have to ask, you know, she did kind of start it.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: Well, absolutely.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You started it.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: Exactly. And unfortunately, it's funny, but it's not funny whatsoever. So in your opinion, Juan, what do you think? Is -- tomorrow are going to see Speaker Pelosi say, now, affirmatively, "No, now you cannot give your State of the Union?" Is that going to be heard coming back? Or what is she doing next?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She's going to be unpacking, actually.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We went over this a little bit. So then the suggestion today from Rand Paul was, well, maybe Mitch McConnell, the Senate majority leader, might invite the president. Of course, he doesn't have the authority to do that. He's not speaker of the House. But -- or the president could give a speech somewhere else. Greg suggested that, with face painting and games and everything else.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: I know the options, but what is Pelosi going to do? Because it's tit-for-tat with these two.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I am so curious about you asking the question that way, because as I recall, Republicans, Mitch McConnell and all, said, "We have a deal, and we're going to pass a budget, a continuing resolution, before Christmas." It was the president who said, "No, I insist on a shutdown if I don't get my wall." That's the fifth-grade tantrum.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: They were passing that, knowing that the president wasn't going to sign it. And so again, we're posturing. So they need to have the president on board. Otherwise, it's just fluff.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They didn't -- but they didn't know he wasn't going to sign it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So in other words, you give into the bullying? Are you saying give into the bullying in every situation? Every time he bullies you, just do what he wants?

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: Well, it's a very good point. Thank you, Juan. And as Dana pointed out, they didn't actually know that he wasn't going to sign it. But that's why you need to have those conversations. They need to be better communicators. That's what they're there for. That's their job. So Jesse --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: -- so what do you think is going to happen? Do you think that the State of the Union is actually going to happen, or are we going to see a rally?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All I know is Pelosi is not going overseas.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: What's going to happen.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I do know this. Juan, are you ready for this shock poll?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'm ready, I'm ready.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: This is an NPR poll, so you can't call it fake news.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Trump gains 19 points with Latino voters during border wall shutdown. What? I'm going to read it again, Juan. During this border wall shutdown where he's been going to the mattresses for more border security, his approval rating went from 31 percent among adult Latinos to 50 percent.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's pretty good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I stunned you. You don't even have to say anything, Juan. I'm just as stunned, too.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I am stunned.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I just can't believe that Latino Americans want the wall as much as I do.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, get out of town.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Who knew?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: In this time of year, winter, you are cherry picking. I don't know how you find them, but you're cherry picking.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, those cherries are delicious.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The polls are pretty clear that --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And you can't have any.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He's losing. He's losing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He's not losing support among Latinos.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, please.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And my other point is, Juan, everybody's talking about these government workers that are out of work. OK? And that's definitely sad. But we don't hear the same concern from the media when liberal policies put American workers out of work. War on coal. We don't see these -- all these people saying, "Oh, my gosh." Illegal aliens taking American jobs. "Oh, my gosh." Manufacturing decline. "Oh, my gosh." You don't hear the same concern. I just wish it was as balanced as it is today.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: So Greg, is this all asinine arrogance, or is it just complete media bias in the sense that you aren't hearing what Jesse's talking about; and what they're saying right now is, you know, we have the Coast Guard, we have TSA workers. Which by the way, I'm traveling this weekend, so this also concerns a lot of people. So why don't we focus on everyone when everyone is affected? Policy going to the left or the right. And Jesse is absolutely right. When you have Democrats increasing taxes, you have people taking home less in their paychecks, but no one is really talking about it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I just wonder if Nancy already paid the neighbor to, like, throw the newspapers over the fence.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Feed the cat.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Feed the cat, water the plants. Think about all the things she was -- she had already set into motion. Then think about her coworkers and staffers back at the office, who thought, "I'm having a week -- I'm having a week without Nancy." Yes, they probably start getting -- wearing their sandals to work. Well, I guess it's too cold for that. And then she's got to show up at work. That's kind of embarrassing. I honestly think -- I'm going to reiterate it. I know that Donald Trump watches the show. You've got to do the alternative People's State of the Union. It will be historical. It will be a first. Do it someplace fun. Have some music.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Start a trend.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You could take the State of the Union out on the road.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, exactly. Exactly.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Every president could do that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. It's like he's disrupted so many areas of the world everywhere. I mean, think about the Correspondents' Dinner, what he did to that. They returned to actually having a journalist there. So maybe you can return this to the written, to the written legend, and he could go have a party, and we can enjoy it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Maybe -- maybe he could invite Joe Wilson.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: Whatever it is with their back and forth --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Remember Joe Wilson said to Obama: "You lie!"

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: Whatever -- whatever it is back and forth, I'm concerned about the people who are not getting paid right now. You have GoFundMe campaigns.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: You have people who are needing this. We need to get this government shutdown over with. All right. Well, guys, a wild cruise ship stunt and what the heck is that thing in the water in Maine? That and more in "The Fastest Five," up next. "Fastest Seven," next. Sorry.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. Time for "The Fastest Seven." First up, what's an easy way to get yourself banned from a cruise ship? Maybe if you do something crazy like this guy.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: (EXPLETIVE DELETED) Oh, my God. (EXPLETIVE DELETED) (LAUGHS)

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Some people are laughing, but Royal Caribbean banned the guy after his 100-foot plunge.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Luckily, he wasn't seriously hurt.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Greg, one of the ways you avoid doing this is to never go on a cruise.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, you know what? Being banned from a cruise line would be my dream.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's a badge of honor.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Because the thing is, I've been asked to go on cruises, and I hate cruises because I don't like -- I don't like events that you can't escape from. You know, the only way you -- if you want to get off a cruise, because you --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Is jump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, you either do that or you fake an illness and you get a helicopter ride. I've looked into this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Is this what they do at the National Review cruise? They just -- everybody jumps off?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I've never been on one, but Greg has.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You have.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. It was interesting. If you get trapped at the bar, you're screwed. Kat Timpf went on one. It was not a pleasant thing for her.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK. Juan, what do you think? This is a little dangerous, though. The guys said -- he said he couldn't walk for three days.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Is that what he said?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I wonder why. I mean, it's extremely dangerous. And I saw that some of the social media people now say they're not going to run --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The video.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- these kinds of videos, because it just encourages bad behavior.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But we will on "The Five." Nicole, what do you think?

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: I mean, this makes for great television and a great thing to see on social media.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Don't do it.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: But to Juan's point, this is very dangerous, and unfortunately, people are going to watch this, and it's going to become the new thing, new challenge.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, is this a new thing now? Is this like the Tide Pod challenge?

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: And he said he hurt his neck and his tailbone, too. you could actually kill yourself doing that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: Because of the impact. This isn't funny.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Darwin Awards.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: This is stupid. Don't do it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Don't do it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. Next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Listen to the doctor.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No. This is not the moon or an alien spacecraft. It's a spinning disk of ice. It formed on a river in Maine this week. Lots of people are mesmerized by this. Scientists say the sharp edges of the 300- foot chunk of ice are rounded off by repeated collisions with the shore or floating debris. And it does look beautiful. I don't know what it is.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This is a great choice for your "Fastest Seven."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I did not choose this. This was chosen by -- producers.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I got this in the mail.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Way to sell sell it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I got this in the mail, I'm going, "We're doing this story?" Actually, a tequila company should descend there and make the world's largest margarita. Just drop -- airdrop tequila. A balloon, giant balloon of tequila and margarita mix.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And salt.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And you salt the rim.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's a great idea.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Salt to the rim.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You made this very interesting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I try. I try.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Alcohol analogies, you are No. 1.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Just put a giant five on it. It would be like our "Five" logo.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, you like this story.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I did. I wanted it to be my "One More Thing." I think the NHL should just put two teams out there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's a better idea.
